title: Introduction to `ve`
goal: Learn how `ve` swaps x1 and x4, putting the fourth place first.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Conversion review:

se swaps x1 ↔ x2
te swaps x1 ↔ x3

Convert: mi benji la cukta la .bob. → ? (with te)

(Answer: la .bob. te benji la cukta mi)

New Material (5-7 min)

The Fourth Place: ve

li mu ve vecnu la cukta mi do — 5 is the price of a book from me to you.

ve swaps x1 and x4. This is useful for gismu with important fourth places.

ve with vecnu

Original vecnu:

vecnu — x1 (seller) sells x2 (goods) to x3 (buyer) for x4 (price)

With ve:

ve vecnu — x1 (price) is-the-price-of x2 (goods) to x3 (buyer) from x4 (seller)
Normal With ve
mi vecnu la cukta do mu no mu no ve vecnu la cukta do mi
I sell a book to you for 50. 50 is the price of a book to you from me.

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
tarja x1 posts x2 at location x3 for audience x4 post/display
tutci x1 is a tool for purpose x2 used by x3 tool

ve with benji

Original: x1 sends x2 to x3 from x4 via x5

With ve: x1 (source/origin) sends x2 to x3 by x4 (sender)

Normal With ve
mi benji la notci do la zdani la zdani ve benji la notci do mi
I send a message to you from home. Home is-the-source of a message to you by me.

When to Use ve

Use ve when:

  1. Discussing prices: "The price is 50" → mu no ve vecnu...
  2. Discussing sources/mediums
  3. Answering questions about fourth-place arguments

Comparing Conversions

Sentence Focus
mi vecnu la cukta do mu no I (seller)
la cukta se vecnu mi do mu no book (goods)
do te vecnu la cukta mi mu no you (buyer)
mu no ve vecnu la cukta do mi 50 (price)

Key Point

ve swaps x1 and x4. For vecnu, this makes the price the topic.

sections.keyPoint: `ve` swaps x1 and x4. For `vecnu`, this makes the price the topic.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Apply ve

Rewrite using ve:

  1. mi vecnu la karce la .bob. pa no no → ?
  2. la .alis. cu vecnu la skami mi re no no → ?
  3. do vecnu la cukta la .tam. mu no → ?
Answers
  1. pa no no ve vecnu la karce la .bob. mi
  2. re no no ve vecnu la skami mi la .alis.
  3. mu no ve vecnu la cukta la .tam. do

Exercise 2: Interpret ve Sentences

Translate to English:

  1. ci no ve vecnu la plise mi la .bob.
  2. pa no no no ve vecnu la karce do mi
Answers
  1. 30 is the price of apples to me from Bob. / Bob sells apples to me for 30.
  2. 1000 is the price of the car to you from me. / I sell the car to you for 1000.

Exercise 3: Choose the Right Conversion

Which conversion focuses on the underlined element?

  1. mi vecnu la cukta do __mu no__ — focus on price → ?
  2. mi vecnu __la cukta__ do mu no — focus on book → ?
  3. mi vecnu la cukta __do__ mu no — focus on buyer → ?
Answers
  1. ve — mu no ve vecnu la cukta do mi
  2. se — la cukta se vecnu mi do mu no
  3. te — do te vecnu la cukta mi mu no

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I sell a book to you for 50." → mi vecnu la cukta do mu no
  2. "50 is the price of the book." → mu no ve vecnu la cukta
  3. "100 is the price of the car to Bob from me." → pa no no ve vecnu la karce la .bob. mi

sections.content:
Summary

You learned ve, which swaps x1 and x4. For vecnu, ve vecnu makes the price the topic. This completes three of the four conversion operators.

Tomorrow preview: You'll drill ve and learn sazri (operate) and zbasu (make).
